page.title: 06CHANGING FACE OF PERRANPORTH
page.content: THE FIRST INHABITANTS OF PERRANPORTH ABOUT WHICH ANYTHING IS KNOWN WERE CREMATED AT CRIGG-A-MENNIS AT THE TOP OF LISKEY HILL IN ABOUT 1300 BC. PERRANPORTH WAS NAMED AFTER ST.PIRAN WHO IS REPUTED TO HAVE LANDED IN THE AREA AFTER JOURNEYING FROM IRELAND ON A MILLSTONE.WITH IT'S GOLDEN SANDS AND PLEASANT CLIMATE THE TOWN HAS MORE RECENTLY DEVELOPED AS A{TOURIST RESORT PROVIDING SHOPS AND AMENITIES FOR THE SEASIDE HOLIDAY MAKER.HOWEVER THE RECENT INCREASE IN PACKAGE HOLIDAYS ABROAD HAS CAUSED THE TOURIST SEASON TO BECOME SHORTENED TO ONLY 2 MONTHS. TO TRY AND COMPENSATE FOR THIS DECLINE MANY HOTELS HAVE BEEN CONVERTED INTO OLD PEOPLES FLATS AND A SCHEME HAS ALSO BEEN INTRODUCED TO PROVIDE HOMES FOR RETIRED PEOPLE FROM THE LONDON AREA. TODAY ALMOST 75% OF THE POPULATION ARE RETIRED PEOPLE.
